author: Ira Winderman
title: Heat-Hornets preview: Charlotte Hornets at Miami Heat
text:
When/Where: 7:30 p.m., AmericanAirlines Arena.
Tickets: Available at HEAT.com or 1-800-4NBA-TIX.
TV: Fox Sports Sun. Radio: 790-AM, 106.3-FM, 710-AM (Spanish).
Scouting report: The Heat enter 15-12 all-time in season openers, with victories in their last four home openers and their last four openers overall . . . The Heat went 2-2 against the Hornets last season, winning both of the meetings at AmericanAirlines Arena, with the teams again to play four times this season . . . This opens a run of 14 of the first 19 games of the season at home for the Heat, with this their only game against a 2015 lottery team among their first four games . . . The Heat enter with a healthy roster, with coach Erik Spoelstra required to list two of his 15 players inactive an hour before tipoff . . . The Hornets shook up their roster in the offseason, adding first-round pick Frank Kaminsky and veterans Nicolas Batum, Jeremy Lin, Tyler Hansbrough and Spencer Hawes . . . Forward Michael Kidd-Gilchrist (shoulder) and guard Jeremy Lamb (ankle) are out for the Hornets, with guard Kemba Walker (heel) probable.
Off the court: Heat T-shirts to the first 20,000.
-- Ira Winderman
 Miami Heat Charlotte Hornets Michael Kidd-Gilchrist Tyler Hansbrough Erik Spoelstra Spencer Hawes Kemba Walker
